definitions: a person who bases their opinions and actions on reason and knowledge rather than on religious belief or emotional response

examples.text: the managers are rationalists who find it hard to understand why anyone should get worked up about the closure of their local hospital
a rationalist with a boyish enthusiasm for modern science

shortDefinitions: person who bases their opinions and actions on reason and knowledge

definitions: a person who believes that reason rather than experience is the foundation of certainty in knowledge

examples.text: like other rationalists, he valorizes the mind over the body

shortDefinitions: person who believes that reason rather than experience is foundation of certainty in knowledge

definitions: a person who considers reason to be the ultimate authority in religion

examples.text: the dispassionate sensibility of Protestant rationalists

shortDefinitions: person who considers reason to be ultimate authority in religion

definitions: based on reason and knowledge rather than on religious belief or emotional response

examples.text: a rationalist approach to the supernatural

definitions: relating to the theory that reason rather than experience is the foundation of certainty in knowledge

examples.text: Harvard College had become a seat of rationalist philosophy

shortDefinitions: relating to theory that reason rather than experience is foundation of certainty in knowledge

definitions: relating to the practice of treating reason as the ultimate authority in religion

examples.text: Toland's unrelentingly rationalist approach to theology went well beyond anything Locke advocated

shortDefinitions: relating to practice of treating reason as ultimate authority in religion
